item.title: SOLAR COOKING 101 - Apr 11,2012
item.description:
TONIGHT: SOLAR COOKING 101 Different Solar optoins How/if recipes, times and planning differes for Solar Cooking. What is Donnas top pick for a Solar Oven. Learn what type pans/pots to use. How to adjust for slow cooking or for high heat baking. This show will help expand your knowlege and excite you about the possabilities of this green, energy-saving cooking optoin! See you there! Best Blessings! Donna Encouragement in the Kitchen with Donna Miller of Millers Grain House: "Preparing you and your kitchen with tools, tips, skills and encouragement." item.title: Choosing, Using & Storing Healthy Oils - Mar 28,2012
item.description:
Tonight on ENCOURAGEMENT IN THE KITCHEN with DONNA MILLER ... We are discussing healthy oils! How to choose them, how to use them and how to store them so they keep for a long time! Smoke points, why are they important. What about FAT? Single chain, Mono-Unsaturated Fatty Acids decifered. Are there healthy saturated fats? Are there imposters on the oil isle? Non-stick spray - friend or foe? Pop a question in the chat room or on our Facebook Page if you have specific questions about this topic. NEW Millers Grain House Site "Preparing you and your kitchen with tools, tips, skills and encouragement."

item.title: Why Mill Whole Wheat & Grains at home? - Mar 14,2012
item.description:
Tonight on ENCOURAGEMENT IN THE KITCHEN with Donna Miller - We are going to discuss the reasons (there are many) for milling whole grains at home. From health to budget the reasons for home milling are often over looked by most people because they feel it will be time consuming or costly. Neither of those assumptions are correct. This show will help you dispel those thoughts. Pop a question in the chat room or on our Facebook Page if you have specific questions about this topic. NEW Millers Grain House Site "Preparing you and your kitchen with tools, tips, skills and encouragement."

item.title: Juicing for Health and Fun! - Mar 07,2012
item.description:
TONIGHT on "Encouragement in the Kitchen" with Donna Miller - Juicing for Health and Fun! Our New Store Site: http://millersgrainhouse.com Hurom Slow Juicer Whole Wheat Bread Making E-Book Four out of six of us in the Miller Family (daughter-in-law included in the count) are going on a Juice Fast/Feast! We are currently on day 3 and counting. Come listen to just what are the benefits of juicing, the best foods to juice and find out what is the best juicer! It doesnt have to always be a fast - juicing can boost the intake of live fruits and veggies during every regular day! . "Preparing you and your kitchen with tools, tips, skills and encouragement."

item.title: Beyond Stocking the Freezer - Feb 29,2012
item.description:
Encouragement in the Kitchen with Donna Miller TONIGHT: Beyond Stocking the Freezer This appliance is more than a huge ice chest. Its a budet booster if you learn how to use it right! Tonight were going to discuss how to stretch money, prolong foods and serve your convenience needs by using the freezer. Using the freezer as the middle-man for longer storage How to freeze to get the best use of items. Planning freezer meals. "Preparing you and your kitchen with tools, tips, skills and encouragement." item.title: Warm Budget Meals for Cold Winter Days - Feb 22,2012
item.description:
"ENCOURAGEMENT IN THE KITCHEN" with Donna Miller TONIGHT: "Baby its COLD outside!". When the temperature drops and the days are short, were often tempted to not eat as healthy. Maybe thats more of a confession than it is a blanket declaration, but the fact remains that the colder weather can be a stumbling block to a healthy diet. Tonight, well talk about some options that dont break the bank and dont have us in the kitchen too terribly long when wed rather be by the fireplace under an afghan.. "Preparing you and your kitchen with tools, tips, skills and encouragement." For many of the tools we talk about and a free recipe each month here visit: http://millersgrainhouse.com VIDEO tutorials - watch here: http://www.youtube.com/thewheatguy See you there! Donna

TONIGHTS EPISODE: WINTER SQUASH What to do with those things that are usually just fall decor! At the bargain prices per pound, these are great nutrition that stretch the grocery budget. Our Mission: "Help prepare you and your kitchen with tools, tips, skills and encouragement." Learn to prepare meals, plan menus, use real whole foods and more skills. One item turned into a variety Left-over Magic Whole grains = whole health Convenience foods from scratch Can/Freeze/Dehydrate Using the Sun to Cook Grocery budget know how. Building a Long-term Pantry Each week a new topic to assist you in a healthy, budget friendly kitchen! FREE recipes sign up at: http://www.eatgrains.com For many of the tools we talk about here visit: http://millersgrainhouse.com VIDEO tutorials - watch here: http://www.youtube.com/thewheatguy See you there! Donna

item.title: Prolonging the Life of Fresh, Raw Foods - May 18,2011
item.description:
Eating more fresh and raw foods is so GREAT for our bodies! But what about for our wallets? If youve been worried about buying fresh produce only to have the stress of it going bad on you before you get to use it ...(weve all been there, havent we?)...then this is a good short show for you! Join our Host, Donna Miller of Millers Grain House and subscribe to her YouTube channel to get to see some visuals on this topic in upcoming episodes! We want to help you stretch your grocery budget without compromising healthy eating habits. I hope youll join us this Wednesday evening at 6:30 PM Eastern Time. Donna also hosts a show on the Preparedness Radio Network called "Your Preparation Station" on Saturday evenings from 8-10 Eastern Time.

item.title: Getting Grain Specific: Popcorn uses that don't pop the budget! - Feb 01,2011
item.description:
MILLERS GRAIN HOUSE Pop Corn is more than a white, fluffy snack smothered in butter at the theater! It can be healthy addition to budget snacks and foods! Join us tonight and learn many different ways to use this versatile grain! It stores well in your long-term food pantry and has more uses than you may imagine! Cornbread,Polenta, Popped Flavors for Snacking Variety, Caramel Corn and more! PS: These links are my videos! To get MORE FREE WHOLE GRAIN FOOD IDEAS go to EAT GRAINS and subscribe! Don't forget to confirm and add us to your 'approved' emails!

item.title: Gluten Sensativity and Home Milling - Dec 08,2010
item.description:
If you've not yet heard my story of gluten sensitivity diagnosis and how home milling came to the rescue, you may want to tune in or download this episode. We're going to talk a bit more about how home milling can first save you money if you are on a gluten free diet and how it may just help reset your digestive track! If you have symptoms and are wondering what you can do, come listen and ask questions. Join me, Donna Miller, for one hour on Tuesday evening to learn more! Want a home mill? Visit Millers Grain House

item.title: Whole Grain Holidays! - Oct 26,2010
item.description:
http://www.youtube.com/thewheatguy What are your plans for the upcoming holidays? Do you know how to include whole grains in some traditional recipes? Let's sneak some healthy stuff in to the good old favorites!! Join me tonight as I share some of our favorite recipes for the holidays and how to make the more healthy for you and your family! Look for our HOLIDAY SPECIAL show coming soon... It will include some make ahead tips and planning ideas for a wonderful holiday. THANKSGIVING IS MY FAVORITE TRADITIONAL HOLIDAY! Hope to see you tonight in the chat room or calling in! Best Blessings! Donna

item.title: Raw Foods and Whole Grains - Oct 12,2010
item.description:
I hope you'll join us for tonight's show!My special guest is Hallie Saunders, owner of An Apple a Day Depot.Hallie's story is one from cancer to cancer free and the joy of sharing this healthy eating plan with others. My personal favorites are her testimony and the tag-line that she and her husband, Sam, use for their restaurant: "Lettuce Nurture You!"Please listen and call in with your questions and find out how REAL whole foods and whole grains are a wealth of prevention for your health! For FREE whole grain recipes go to: http://www.eatgrains.com

item.title: Grain Mill Comparison - Which one is for me? - Aug 19,2010
item.description:
See this - GRAIN MILL COMPARISON CHART for help! If you, a family member or a friend are looking to invest in a home mill, you may want to share and save the link to this Thursday Night's show. How easy is this one to use? What features does that one have? Clean up and use? How big is that? Which is the quietest? All these are great questions when considering a grain mill for home use. Every home and family has different needs and schedules. Time to ask some questions! Tune in to THIS EPISODE of our show to find out more about a wide variety of mills for home milling. Call, Chat and Listen! Best Blessings ~ See you there! Donna at Millers Grain House

item.title: Adding Different Grains to our diets - Mar 10,2010
item.description:
Just like a variety of fruits and veggies (eating many different colors) a variety of grains is good for your body. But...we usually just use wheat or corn. Alhtough not bad grains when used freshly milled or whole, there are more great grains out there!! What are some ideas for using grains like millet, different rices, barley, oats, spelt, kamut....more.... Let's share and talk about what nutrients are in the other lesser used grains and find some ideas together on how to add them to our healthy diet plan. Call in or chat live! Hope to see you there! Hope you come and share!

item.title: Bulk buying and food storage - Part 4 - Jan 06,2010
item.description:
The finale in the series, but of course not the end of learning! This episode will deal with dry good storage (my favorite) of grains, beans and granualated items (raw sugar) in bulk. We will talk about canning and dehydrating and storing these foods as well. Also we will tie up any loose ends and touch on options for rotating your food storage system! Come join us for the series fanale episode! I hope you'll share and ask questions! See you Tuesday Evening at 7PM Eastern Time! Best Blessings! Donna

EnJOY!

item.title: Left-over magic ideas - Oct 27,2009
item.description:
The fridge is full, there's no room left but there's only odd little pieces of 'stuff'...what can we do with that hodge-podge of tiny tid-bits? DON'T THROW IT AWAY YET (as long as it's edible anyway). Listen for some ideas and tricks to making magic out of left-overs...that yes, will actually get eaten. These are budget stretching staple tips. At least 10 minutes of the show is call-in/chat Q & A's....so just hop on at 7pm EasterntTime on Tuesdays and join in! EnJOY!

item.title: Store- bought vs. home-made. - Oct 20,2009
item.description:
Let's learn to label read! Yikes! GMO, trans-fats, palm oil, bisphenol-A....what? Store-bought may be easily accessible, but is it what is best and healthy for our bodies? Can we believe the labels or are there loop-holes? Isn't it cheaper to buy it than make it? How easy ARE some of those things to make at home? How convenient is it? You may ask "Can *I* do it?" Yes, if I can you can! I'm here to help! At least 10 minutes of the show is call-in/chat Q & A's....so just hop on at 7pm Eastern Time on Tuesdays! EnJOY!
